intro: Galium anisophyllon var. sudeticum, commonly known as the Sudetic wood-sorrel, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Central and Eastern Europe. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its opposite, heart-shaped leaves and small white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a fibrous root system and produces small, capsule-like fruits. Its foliage is often used in traditional herbal medicine for its purported health benefits.
